intro: Scleranthus soroanus, commonly known as the mountain sow-thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its structure includes a prostrate or ascending stem with numerous branches, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Scleranthus soroanus is often found in alpine meadows and is a hardy species that thrives in cooler climates.
